wbqc-desc: Checks constraints on both items and properties and displays the results on a special page
wbqc-constraintreport-explanation-part-o: This special page performs constraint checks on any entity you want. The entities are fetched from the live system, so every constraint violation you fix there will be instantly removed from this list.
wbqc-constraintreport-explanation-part-t: The constraints are parsed from statements on properties each time those statements are edited, usually within a few minutes.
wbqc-constraintreport-empty-result: There are no constraints defined on this entity.
wbqc-potentialissues-long: This statement has some potential issues.
wbqc-badparameters-long: This constraint statement has some invalid parameters.
wbqc-parameterissues-long: These issues are problems with the constraint definition on the property, not with this statement.
wbqc-constrainttypehelp-long: Help page for this constraint type
apihelp-wbcheckconstraints-description: Performs constraint checks on any entity you want and returns the result.
apihelp-wbcheckconstraints-summary: Performs constraint checks on any entity you want and returns the result.
apihelp-wbcheckconstraints-param-id: ID list of the entities to get the data from. Separate values with '|' or alternative.
apihelp-wbcheckconstraints-param-claimid: GUID list identifying a claim to check a constraint report.  Separate values with '|'.
apihelp-wbcheckconstraints-param-constra: Optional filter to return only the constraints that have the specified constraint ID
apihelp-wbcheckconstraintparameters-summ: Checks the constraint parameters of constraint statements.
apihelp-wbcheckconstraintparameters-exte: Either or both of the <var>property</var> and <var>constraintid</var> parameters may be specified; all constraints selected by either parameter will be checked.
apihelp-wbcheckconstraintparameters-para:
List of property IDs to check. All constraint statements of these properties will be checked.

If this parameter is specified, it must be nonempty.

List of constraint IDs (constraint statement GUIDs) to check.

If this parameter is specified, it must be nonempty.
apihelp-wbcheckconstraints-example-1: Check all constraints on the items Q5 and Q42.
apihelp-wbcheckconstraints-example-2: Check all constraints on a single statement.
apihelp-wbcheckconstraints-example-3: Check one particular constraint on the item Q2.
apihelp-wbcheckconstraintparameters-exam: Check constraint parameters of all constraints on a property.
Check constraint parameters of two particular constraints.
wbqc-violation-message: Constraint check has pointed out a violation. Please click on icon for further information.
wbqc-violation-message-not-yet-implement: For technical reasons, the check for the constraint "$1" has not yet been implemented.
wbqc-violation-message-security-reason: For security reasons, it is not possible to check the "$1" constraint at the moment. We are working on a solution.
wbqc-violation-message-value-needed-of-t: Properties with constraint "$1" need to have values of type "$2".
Properties with constraint "$1" need to have values of type "$2" or "$3".
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-needed: Properties with constraint "$1" need a parameter "$2".
wbqc-violation-message-parameters-needed: Properties with constraint "$1" need parameters "$2",  "$3", and  "$4".
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-value: The parameter "$1" must have a custom value, not "no value" or "unknown value".
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-value-o: The parameter "$1" must have a custom value or "no value", but never "unknown value".
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-entity: The value for the parameter "$1" must be an entity, not "$2".
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-item: The value for the parameter "$1" must be an item, not "$2".
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-propert: The value for the parameter "$1" must be a property, not "$2".
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-string: The value for the parameter "$1" must be a string, not "$2".
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-monolin: The value for the parameter "$1" must be a monolingual text, not "$2".
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-single: The parameter "$1" must only have a single value.
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-single-: The parameter "$1" must only have a single value per language, but has multiple values for $2 ($3).
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-oneof: The parameter "$1" must be {{PLURAL:$2|1=$4.|2=either $4 or $5.|one of the following:$3}}
wbqc-violation-message-parameter-regex: $1 is not a valid regular expression.
wbqc-violation-message-sparql-error: The SPARQL query resulted in an error.
wbqc-violation-message-parameters-error-: The parameters of this constraint could not be imported.
The parameters of this constraint could not be imported because they were too long.
wbqc-violation-message-commons-link-chec: Check for namespace "$1" is not yet implemented.
wbqc-violation-message-conflicts-with-pr: An entity should not have statements for both $1 and $2.
wbqc-violation-message-conflicts-with-cl: An entity should not have a statement for $1 if it also has a statement for $2 with value $3.
wbqc-violation-message-diff-within-range: The difference between $3 ($4) and $1 ($2) should be between $5 and $6 ([$5; $6]).
The difference between $3 ($4) and $1 ($2) should be no more than $5 ((−∞; $5]).
The difference between $3 ($4) and $1 ($2) should be no less than $5 ([$5; ∞)).
The property defined in the parameters must exist.
The property defined in the parameters must have a value of the same type as this property.
wbqc-violation-message-format: The value for $1 ($2) should match the pattern $3.
wbqc-violation-message-inverse: $1 should also have the inverse statement $2 $3.
wbqc-violation-message-item: An entity with $1 should also have {{PLURAL:$3|0=a statement $2.|1=a statement $2 $5.|a statement for $2 with one of the following values:$4}}
wbqc-violation-message-mandatory-qualifi: This $1 statement is missing a qualifier $2.
wbqc-violation-message-multi-value: This property should contain multiple values. That is, there should be more than one statement using this property.
wbqc-violation-message-one-of: The value for $1 should be {{PLURAL:$2|1=$4.|2=either $4 or $5.|one of the following:$3}}
wbqc-violation-message-qualifier: The property should only be used as a qualifier.
wbqc-violation-message-no-qualifiers: $1 statements should not have any qualifiers.
wbqc-violation-message-qualifiers: $2 is not a valid qualifier for $1 – the only valid {{PLURAL:$3|1=qualifier is $5.|2=qualifiers are $5 and $6.|qualifiers are:$4}}
wbqc-violation-message-range-parameters-: Properties with values of type "$1" with constraint "$4" need the parameters "$2" and "$3".
wbqc-violation-message-range-quantity-cl: The value for $1 ($2) should be between $3 and $4 ([$3; $4]).
wbqc-violation-message-range-quantity-le: The value for $1 ($2) should be no more than $3 ((−∞; $3]).
wbqc-violation-message-range-quantity-ri: The value for $1 ($2) should be no less than $3 ([$3; ∞)).
wbqc-violation-message-range-time-closed: The value for $1 ($2) should be between $3 and $4.
wbqc-violation-message-range-time-leftop: The value for $1 ($2) should not be after $3.
wbqc-violation-message-range-time-righto: The value for $1 ($2) should not be before $3.
wbqc-violation-message-single-value: This property should only contain a single value. That is, there should only be one statement using this property.
wbqc-violation-message-symmetric: $1 should also have the symmetric statement $2 $3.
wbqc-violation-message-type-instance: Entities using the $1 property should be instances of {{PLURAL:$3|1=$5|2=$5 or $6|one of the following classes}} (or of {{PLURAL:$3|1=a subclass of it|2=a subclass of them|one of their subclasses}}), but $2 currently {{PLURAL:$3|1=isn't.|2=isn't.|isn't: $4}}
wbqc-violation-message-type-subclass: Entities using the $1 property should be subclasses of {{PLURAL:$3|1=$5|2=$5 or $6|one of the following classes}} (or of {{PLURAL:$3|1=a subclass of it|2=a subclass of them|one of their subclasses}}), but $2 currently {{PLURAL:$3|1=isn't.|2=isn't.|isn't: $4}}
wbqc-violation-message-valueType-instanc: Values of $1 statements should be instances of {{PLURAL:$3|1=$5|2=$5 or $6|one of the following classes}} (or of {{PLURAL:$3|1=a subclass of it|2=a subclass of them|one of their subclasses}}), but $2 currently {{PLURAL:$3|1=isn't.|2=isn't.|isn't: $4}}
wbqc-violation-message-valueType-subclas: Values of $1 statements should be subclasses of {{PLURAL:$3|1=$5|2=$5 or $6|one of the following classes}} (or of {{PLURAL:$3|1=a subclass of it|2=a subclass of them|one of their subclasses}}), but $2 currently {{PLURAL:$3|1=isn't.|2=isn't.|isn't: $4}}
wbqc-violation-message-target-required-c: $1 should have {{PLURAL:$3|0=a statement $2.|1=a statement $2 $5.|a statement for $2 with one of the following values:$4}}
wbqc-violation-message-unique-value: This property's value must not be present on any other item, but is also present on {{PLURAL:$1|1=$3.|2=$3 and $4.|the following items: $2}}
wbqc-exception-message: This entity is a known exception for this constraint and has been marked as such.
